title: Paris Olympics' Club France is 'the place to be' for supporters, athletes and ever-present sponsors
summary: The venue, located at La Villette in Paris, can accommodate 25,000 people at any one time, including 5,000 inside and 20,000 on the adjacent lawns. By the middle of the week, it was welcoming between 39,000 and 40,000 people a day.

title: Mondo Duplantis breaks his own pole vault world record with second gold at Olympics
summary: The 24-year-old cleared 6.25 meters on Monday night with his second straight gold medal performance.

title: France beats Egypt 3-1, faces Spain in men's soccer final at Paris Olympics
summary: France, looking for their second Olympic men's football gold medal and first since 1984, now face Spain in the final at the Parc des Princes in Paris on Friday.

title: Basketball at the 2024 Olympics: The French team still searching for the right balance as the quarter-finals get underway
summary: Les Bleus face Canada in the quarter-finals on Tuesday against a backdrop of disagreements between certain players and staff over strategic options.

title: Prime Minister forced to flee Bangladesh by helicopter
summary: A crackdown on demonstrators left around 100 people dead on Sunday. The army announced the formation of an interim government.

title: Israeli prisons 'operate like torture camps' for Palestinian detainees
summary: A report by the human rights organization B'Tselem has denounced the 'widespread, systematic and prolonged commission of the crime of torture' by the Netanyahu government.

title: Gymnastics at the 2024 Olympics: Simone Biles denied gold on beam and floor
summary: The American gymnast's fall benefited Italy's Alice D'Amato, who won the Olympic beam title. On floor, Brazil's Rebeca Andrade won by a margin of 0.33 points.

title: Paris Olympics: Russia's absence has benefited no single country
summary: At the Tokyo Olympics, Russia won 71 medals, 20 of them gold. As the second week of the Paris Games gets underway, no delegation has largely profited from these undefended medals.

title: Rockets launched at base hosting US troops in Iraq, Biden holds crisis talks to avoid all-out war in Middle East
summary: President Joe Biden held crisis talks on Monday on a potential Iranian counterattack on Israel as his administration said it was working around the clock to avoid all-out war in the Middle East.

title: In Tunisia, the president Kais Saied buries the gains of the democratic transition a little more deeply
summary: The detention of Sihem Bensedrine, human rights activist and former president of the Truth & Dignity Commission, is a further blow to the regime's opponents.

title: Paris Olympics: Léon Marchand has swept France off its feet
summary: With four Olympic gold medals in as many individual events and a bronze medal in the relay to round off his marathon of 14 races in one week, the 22-year-old swimmer is already one of the heroes of these Games.

title: For the Olympics, the former Paris stock exchange hosts a VIP American sports bar
summary: The American Olympic Committee has set up its Team USA House in the  Palais Brongniart, the former headquarters of the Paris stock exchange. Admission costs €325 plus tax.

title: Middle East braces for Iran and its allies' retaliation
summary: Iran and its allies have stepped up their threats against Israel following the targeted assassination in Tehran of Ismail Haniyeh, head of the Hamas political bureau. The US announced that it was stepping up its military presence in the region.

title: Paris Olympics: The 'Africa Station' fan zone knows how to party
summary: The venue, located at the Robert-César stadium on the banks of the Seine, has brought together a Club 2024 and a cultural space for the continent's fifty-three delegations. Local residents flock to the site.

title: In Venezuela, 'Nicolas Maduro's only strategy at the moment is to hold on to power'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, Venezuelan political scientist Colette Capriles says the 'democratic transition in Venezuela requires dialogue between all the political forces.'

title: Paris Olympics: Noah Lyles wins 100 m on photo finish for first Olympic title
summary: The 27-year-old sprinter beat Jamaica's Kishane Thompson and fellow American Fred Kerley. The US hadn't won the title since the 2004 Athens Games.

title: Paris 2024: Artistic swimming is open to men, but will take place without them
summary: For the first time in the history of the Olympic Games, the artistic swimming team events are officially mixed-gender. However, none of the 10 nations competing in them has male swimmers on its team.

title: Olympic pole vaulters, an unusual brotherhood united by a touch of madness
summary: The discipline, both dangerous and spectacular, represents a unique microcosm in the world of athletics. Its practitioners praise the 'great solidarity' fostered by the nature of the competitions.

title: Paris Olympics: Safe zones set up to combat sexual and gender-based violence
summary: Prevention and reception spaces for victims and witnesses have been created in areas of festivities. These include 'safe zones,' an idea borrowed from music festivals, set up at La Villette and Hôtel de Ville, where around 10 cases have been handled since July 20.
